subject: Mental Health
title: Alcohol: The Socially Accepted Drug
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Alcohol: The Socially Accepted Drug.

hook.text: Alcohol is the most widely used addictive substance and the third leading cause of death.

buildup.text: It enhances GABA (calming) and suppresses glutamate (excitatory) in the brain.

discovery.text: Chronic use rewires the brain to depend on alcohol to feel calm or normal.

twist.text: Alcohol withdrawal can be fatal ‚Äî the brain, now overexcited, may trigger seizures.

climax.text: About 15 million Americans have alcohol use disorder; most never seek treatment.

punchline.text: Legal doesn't mean safe. Popular doesn't mean harmless.

quiz.question: Why can alcohol withdrawal be dangerous?
options: The brain becomes overexcited and may trigger seizures
